description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Khao Lak" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Khao Lak

places.generalDescription: Coconut Beach in Khao Lak, Thailand is a picturesque destination known for its soft white sands, clear turquoise waters, and coconut palm-fringed shoreline. Nestled just 2 kilometers from Pakarang Beach, this idyllic spot offers a serene escape with stunning views of the Andaman Sea. Protected from strong waves by Parakang Cape to the west, it's perfect for swimming and relaxation.

sources.snippet:
Location: Coconut Beach on Google Map
Coconut beach is located directly south of Ao Thong beach (White sand beach). It is the
southern continuation of Ao Thong beach, and you will find a similar landscape of beautiful
white sand and an expanding line of palm trees. Here you have your choice of small restaurants located directly on the beach.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beach | Which One to Visit?

sources.snippet: Coconut Beach, also known as Pak Weeb Beach, is truly unique in this region and definitely belongs on the list of the best beaches in Khao Lak. It is located in the north of the resort and together with White Sand Beach, it is a part of Pak Weep coast. Here you feel stranded in paradise!
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: As its name suggests, Coconut Beach is dotted with towering tropical trees that make it a unique landscape. The sand here is bright and delicate, its waters a perfect blend of blue and green. This is the best beach in all of Khao Lak if you‚Äôre traveling with the whole family.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Beaches to Visit in Khao Lak for Every Traveler

sources.snippet: Still a sub-section to Pak Weep Beach, and much like its neighbor White Sand Beach, it‚Äôs not widely known by tourists. I like that there are fewer shopping stalls in comparison to some other beaches in Khao Lak that have been fully capitalised on with hotels.
sources.shortName: Exploring the Beaches in Khao Lak: A Complete Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Just around the corner from White Sand beach is Coconut Beach, so it has the benefit of also having stunning sand. A lovely restaurant is right on the beach, but having turned up at Chinese New. Year Day it was funnily enough very closed.
sources.shortName: 6 Most Beautiful Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: It is a quiet beach, seldom visited by tourists, making it the perfect place to enjoy your solitude. Bring a towel, a book and relax. There is a nice restaurant that offers Thai food at reasonable prices.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beaches - Explore the Beaches Around Khao Lak

sources.snippet: One of our absolute favorite beaches in Khao Lak is Coconut Beach. The name suits it to the T, as there are plenty of coconut trees adorning the beach!. Just check out this entrance to the beach!
sources.siteName: Wanderlust Storytellers - An Inspirational Family Travel Blog
sources.shortName: Your Guide to The Best Khao Lak Beaches in Thailand

places.name: Coconut beach

reviews.text: Nice quiet beach. But you may get a little greeting from a jellyfish, it's a bit annoying, I was treated by a nice lady from the buffet, but I recommend taking a small bottle of vinegar with you (this applies to the whole Khao Lak area)

Coconut Beach was the perfect escape - we loved the peaceful, remote vibe. There were a few great beach bars to choose from, each with its own charm. The highlight? Getting a massage right on the beach while listening to the waves. Pure bliss!

We had a really great afternoon at Coconut beach! The staff at the beach bars were really lovely, we had nice drinks for 120 baht, and the fries we had were great too!
For paying guests you can also use their toilets and showers for free.

places.address: Khuekkhak, Takua Pa District, Phang Nga, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Devasom Khao Lak Beach Resort & Villas is a luxurious beachfront retreat that embodies the rich heritage of Southeast Asia. The resort boasts stylish accommodations, exquisite handmade artworks, and furnishings that tell the genuine story of the peninsula. Guests can expect Thai hospitality from real people and enjoy breathtaking views of the Andaman Sea. Located just 10 minutes from the city center by complimentary hotel shuttles, this resort offers a delightful breakfast with varied and fresh choices.

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs much quieter, and it‚Äôs home to some amazing hotels (I took my partner to the best Khao Lak resort, the Devasom ‚Äì more on that below). Remember, when people say ‚ÄòKhao Lak‚Äô they‚Äôre referring to a 20km stretch of white-sand beaches. There is no town called ‚ÄòKhao Lak‚Äô, I explain more about that in my Khao Lak Itinerary below.
sources.shortName: The PERFECT Khao Lak Itinerary; Things to do in Khao Lak

places.name: Devasom Khao Lak Beach Resort & Villas

reviews.text:
Just returned from our second visit to this lovely resort, we even had the same room, at our request!
The location is great, on the edge of a lovely quiet beach, very nice pool where we spent most of our time, and a unique and very unusual design of the resort itself.
Every single member of the staff were friendly and helpful, including reception, the staff in the restaurants, the people who clean the rooms, and the security team who look after the parking area etc.
I cant recommend Devasom highly enough, would give 6 stars if I could !
We will return for sure 100%

A beautiful resort with interesting architecture for lovers of aesthetics.
It is located on the seashore.

I would like to highlight a special feature of this resort in the activities for guests.

Here you can take a walk in the garden and learn more about plants, attend a mindfulness session, come to yoga, participate in creative workshops.

A sufficient number of activities are included in the accommodation price.

Exhibitions are also held on the premises, and there is a very beautiful SPA here.

One of the most pleasantly fulfilling living experiences for me.

A sincere recommendation

Absolutely wonderful resort! From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed with beautiful smiles. We stayed in the Sky Pool Villa for 3 nights, and although we had some rainy days (expected in the rainy season), it didn't bother us at all - the villa was fabulous! I even enjoyed the stunning pool while it was raining.

The main pool and the beach were both beautiful. A special thanks to Max, who took great care of us throughout our stay. The spa experience was also amazing - Mai gave me two massages, and she truly knows what she's doing.

Hope to stay here again

places.address: 79 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà 3 ‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏Å, Takua Pa District, Phang Nga 82220, Thailand

places.generalDescription: White Sand Beach Khao Lak is a popular destination known for its pristine white sand and tranquil atmosphere. It is located just north of Coconut Beach and offers a serene setting with coconut palms providing shade along the coastline. Despite being frequented by many visitors, the beach maintains its calm ambiance. Additionally, there are private dining experiences available at this location, including options such as dinner by a jungle waterfall or on an exclusive private island.

sources.snippet: As its name suggests, Coconut Beach is dotted with towering tropical trees that make it a unique landscape. The sand here is bright and delicate, its waters a perfect blend of blue and green. This is the best beach in all of Khao Lak if you‚Äôre traveling with the whole family.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Beaches to Visit in Khao Lak for Every Traveler

sources.snippet: Right Between Pakarang Cape in the south, to Pak Weep Beach in the north is where you will find White Sand Beach. 2,600 meters of, as the name indicates, white sand beach and with azure blue sea in front it is surely one of the more attractive beaches in the Khao Lak area.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Khao Lak | TKL-ToursKhaoLak.com

places.name: White Sand Beach Khao Lak

reviews.text: Looking for a beachfront dining experience even when it's raining? This restaurant is the perfect choice. During our lunch, we barely saw the sun, but the charming bungalows with individual tables provided excellent wind and rain protection. The beach is just steps away (less than 10 meters from your table). The food is fantastic, and the staff are exceptional. Prices are comparable to other restaurants, but the service and facilities here stand out. Plus, the bathrooms are clean and spacious, in case that worries you ü§≠

A lovely little oasis where you can rent an umbrella and two sunbeds for 100baht. Although the ocean was murky the day we visited, it didn't stop us swimming and enjoying this lovely spot! Great photo opportunities with some swings and plenty of palm trees.

White Sand Beach restaurant is a lovely place to relax and enjoy delicious food on the beach! Prices are great and the beach itself is beautiful and great for swimming too. While it can get super busy here, we didn't mind it too much. Sitting under the shade of the trees was also so pleasant! Highly recommend this place for a relaxing day on the beach ‚ò∫Ô∏è

places.generalDescription: Memories Beach Bar is a tropical beach spot in Khao Lak that offers captivating live jazz music with a backdrop of the open sea. The bar features a relaxed atmosphere and gentle sea breezes, making it an ideal setting for enjoying live music. Additionally, the restaurant offers a diverse menu with Western and Thai dishes, including unique fusion options like Ham and Cheese Spring Rolls.

sources.snippet: Create some once-in-a-lifetime memories with your family and enjoy the bliss of Memories Beach. You can even get yourselves free sun loungers and enjoy a whole day of vitamin sea!. Memories Beach also has the popular Memories Beach Bar, where you can order yourselves some yummy cocktails and sundowners, as well as some remarkably tasty meals!
sources.siteName: Wanderlust Storytellers - An Inspirational Family Travel Blog
sources.shortName: Your Guide to The Best Khao Lak Beaches in Thailand

sources.snippet: The heart of the surf scene in Khao Lak is at Memories Beach Bar at the northern end of the gently sloping sandy Khuk Khak Beach. Waves here break out at the back, then roll in a long way as gentle white waves perfect for beginners trying to learn the popup. Fairly often you can get great conditions with occasional overhead waves.
sources.shortName: 7 best things to do in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Memories beach is a favorite hangout for Rawai Muay Thai guests. This stunning beach is located about 15 minutes from the gym, down a winding dirt road that winds through rubber tree plantations. You can sip tropical fruit drinks and listen to reggae music while taking in the tropical view at  Memories Bar and restaurant.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beaches - Explore the Beaches Around Khao Lak
The PERFECT Khao Lak Itinerary; Things to do in Khao Lak

places.name: Memories Beach Bar

reviews.text:
Amazing beach üèùÔ∏è

Clear blue water, soft white sands, full of bars and restaurants, there are massage shop too.
Seating area are nice and comfy. I went to the end of the beach where it's more quieter and chill. Which is super amazing.
Toilets and shower rooms are free and surprisingly clean and well maintained.
Plenty of parking spaces.

It's definitely Perfect place to spend your day !

A beautiful surfers paradise. Crystal clear waters which you can walk into with soft sand underfoot. Off beaten track so take a taxi. Don't stay past dark though as critter do come out. Was my favorite beach in Khoa Lak although there is not a bad one. Defo worth a visit

Food took very long to arrive. We ordered chicken curry and tomy yum soup  both in the conoconut. The curry was amazing,maybe best i ever had.but the tomy yum soup was really disgusting, with an auful smell. Was nice from them to actually remove it from the bill.

places.address: Pakarang Beach,Khao Lak, Khuekkhak, Takua Pa District, Phang Nga 82220, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nang Thong Beach, located near La On in Khao Lak, is a popular destination for tourists. The beach offers a variety of activities such as swimming, snorkeling, and sunbathing. Despite its popularity, Nang Thong Beach maintains a peaceful atmosphere with clean sands and palm tree shade. Visitors can enjoy stunning sunsets and free sunloungers that can be easily rearranged. The 2.

sources.snippet: Here at Nang Thong Beach Khao Lak is where the iconic lighthouse is located. Nang Thong Beach is close to La On which is also called ‚ÄúKhao Lak Center‚Äù by tourists, easy to find, this is where there are the most shops, and unless you are staying at Khao Lak village before the mountain, you will certainly go through La On and pass Nang Thong on your way to your resort. As Nang Thong Beach is one of the more popular beaches in Khao Lak area, swimming, snorkeling, sunbathing, it all happens here.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Khao Lak | TKL-ToursKhaoLak.com

sources.snippet: Why this beach isn‚Äôt busier is a mystery to us all, but Nang Thong is another great option for those wishing to relax with a little peace and quiet. Just south of Khao Lak beach, the clean sands and the shade of the palm trees nearby make this an obvious choice for lazy days in the sun, and if you find yourself here in the evening you‚Äôll witness some truly amazing sunsets. Unlike some destinations, sunloungers here can be used for free and rearranged as you wish.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: This beach is the heart of tourism in Khoa Lak, so it is quite busy and has a wide variety of shops and restaurants available. It also has a vibrant nightlife scene as well as diving schools, book stores, doctors, dentists, tailors, and luxury hotels and bungalows. Nang Thong is also known for it‚Äôs swimming, sunbathing, and snorkelling as well as the rocks and palm trees along the beach.
sources.shortName: Amazing Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Being on this 2.5-kilometer-long strip of golden sandy beach will make you think that you‚Äôre in a postcard. Nang Thong Beach is picture-perfect in every angle, with turquoise blue waters on one side and majestic coconut trees on the other. Further deep into the village, you‚Äôll find a lively hub of shops, restaurants, and markets where you can mingle with both locals and tourists alike.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Beaches to Visit in Khao Lak for Every Traveler

sources.snippet: This place is called the capital of Khao Lak‚Äôs beaches because of its wide array of restaurants and shops. Nang Thong is the perfect spot for water activities like swimming and snorkeling, and you can take a break under the palm trees along the shore. Other than the diving schools that are abundant here, luxury hotels, tailors, book stores, and medical clinics also populate the area.
sources.shortName: Our Guide to 7 Must-Visit Beaches in Khao Lak, Thailand

sources.snippet: Nang Thong Beach is actually the heart and soul of Khao Lak, meaning that it is constantly populated by both locals and tourists from across the globe. This beach houses a vast variety of shops and restaurants. Also, you can expect a vibrant nightlife scene, diving schools, book stores, doctors, dentists, tailors, luxury hotels, and bungalows on this beach.
sources.shortName: 5 Must See Beaches When Visiting Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Depending on your activity level, you will usually find something to match your energy at Nang Thong Beach. The first thing that stands out about this beach is the unusual golden sand that meets the almost-white waters at a beautiful arc. The beach area is wrapped around thick vegetation, which helps contribute to the resulting ambiance.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak snorkeling review ~ Thailand

sources.snippet: Ban Thap Thawan is at the top of the coastline and is blessed with amazingly white sand and clear shallow waters. Le Meridien is a large resort designed to offer everything guests need to spend their entire holiday in the hotel. There are some restaurants and bars on the beach to get a bit of tropical feel and cheaper prices too.
sources.shortName: The Beaches of Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Nang Thong Beach is definitely one of the most beautiful beaches in Khao Lak!. The approximately 2.5 kilometers long golden sandy beach captivates especially with its dreamlike ambience. This beach is a true postcard motif, and the tropical trees together with the rock formations conjure up a particularly impressive backdrop.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Do: Sunbeds are available at a cheap cost so that you can claim your portion of the beach and sunbathe in style. The shallow waters of the coast are great for a spot of snorkeling, and upon crashing onto the shores the waters give way to several rock pools, perfect for searching out some pint-sized sea creatures within.
sources.shortName: Exploring the Beaches in Khao Lak: A Complete Travel Guide

sources.snippet: The main road ‚Äî Phet Kasem (aka Rte. 4) ‚Äî runs just to the east of Nang Thong beach. The largest number of resorts, restaurants, convenience stores and travel companies are found both on Phet Kasem at the centre of town and along Nang Thong beach itself. Nang Thong is the true centre of the Khao Lak area.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak travel guide

sources.snippet: The beach is golden yellow, with sporadic granite rock protrusions and large casuarina trees and coconut palms around the edges. It is a wide beach, with a background of tropical trees on the mountain slopes. It is a perfect place for walks and has the best facilities of all the beaches.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak

sources.snippet: The surrounding area which includes La On village has the biggest selection of shops, restaurants and bars. Khao Lak is never a raving party and nightlife place but this area is as lively as it gets. The beach is ideal for swimming or just lounging around.
sources.shortName: Phang Nga and Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Located within the main shopping, dining and nightlife area. It is ideal for those who want to stay within walking distance and modern day comforts. Bang Niang Beach is in close competition with good accommodation facilities and restaurants popping up.
sources.shortName: 7 best things to do in Khao Lak

sources.snippet:
Nang Thong Beach is located in the center of Khao Lak, it is one of the first beaches in the
region to be developed. This beach, like Poseidon Beach, is dotted with round granite rocks. The view of Khao Lak
lighthouse will enhance your sunset photos.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beach | Which One to Visit?

sources.snippet: It runs roughly roughly parallel to the main highway through the town. It is a short walk away from a string of resorts of various size and type (hotel style, bungalow or mixed) that line the southern end of the beach.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beaches - Tourist Info

places.name: Nang Thong Beach

reviews.text: A beautiful close to nature beach. We found a lot of wildlife here like crabs, snake, lizard and interesting birds. It's not a typical commercial beach and in the morning there's hardly any space to put your towel down because of the tide, but you just have to walk 10 minutes to get to a good spot. It's great for walking and exploring. Also beautiful sunsets.
Very good hotel good clean rooms nice pool for all ages plenty of places around to visit restaurants and bars really good a little more expensive than outside but I really enjoyed my stay here

Beautiful and secluded more than other areas. I missed it the first time in Khao Lak, but found this street with restraunts leading to the beach on our next visit. Much nicer here than the surrounding area

places.address: J6VW+XRF, 91 Phetkasem Road, Khuekkhak, Takua Pa District, Phang Nga 82190, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Khao Lak-Lam Ru National Park, named after its two peaks, is a tropical forest park known for its scenic beaches and diverse wildlife. The area has rebounded from the 2004 tsunami and now offers vibrant tourism experiences. Visitors can enjoy sunbathing on Khao Lak beach, engaging in conservation activities, and exploring the rich underwater world off the Andaman Sea coast. The park also features mesmerizing waterfalls and abundant wildlife for nature enthusiasts to explore.

sources.snippet: The actual Khao Lak beach is a small one, located just south of Khaolak Lamru National Park, but the name "Khao Lak" is generally used to refer to a 30 km long coastal area from Bang Sak to the north and the Thap Lamu pier area to the south. Beaches continue all the way north up to Ban Nam Khem and Ko Kho Khao and south down to Thai Muang and Phuket, so if you like long walks on the beach, the general Phang Nga coastal area ‚Äî with Khao Lak at its centre ‚Äî is a good choice.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak travel guide

sources.snippet: The visit to Lam Ru National Park is highly recommended because here you will find one of the most beautiful beaches in the area. It is located in the south of the vacation region, very close to the village of Khao Lak. From the national park entrance on the main road, you can take a short 10-minute hike through the jungle directly to this hidden natural gem.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: There is the Khao Lak Lam Ru National Park over the Lak Mountain with a great range of flora and fauna, various species of mammals, reptiles and birds. It also has a rainforest where travellers, in hiking or trekking trips to the rainforest, would be accompanied by fluttering butterflies in their bright colours.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do in Khao Lak 2021

sources.snippet: One of these is Lam Ru, located in the southern part of the region. It features a dense rainforest on one side and an alluring coast of beaches on the other. Trek along the lush hills in the morning and enjoy a leisurely swim in the afternoon.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Beaches to Visit in Khao Lak for Every Traveler

places.name: Khao Lak-Lam Ru National Park

reviews.text: It's pretty. I loved the beach the most. There's also a restaurant and toilets. You could have a picnic there too.

We entered the Lam Ru National Park close to the big road in Khao Lak. Ticket was 100 baht per person. The trail goes 1,1 km to Small Sandy Beach. At first this distance seems nothing but actually the terrain can be a bit challenging and takes more time than you think. In pictures it's difficult to understand but it goes up and down and mostly nature trail, not stairs. Lots of roots, rocks, uneven steps. For elderly and kids, I'd say it's challenging.
Be aware, on this trail you won't find a waterfall.
There are toilets, and one restaurant and at the beach one cafe. Trail is open until 16.30 and don't exactly remember the wording, but being out there after that time can bring you a penalty up to 100 000 baht.

Overall we enjoyed the hike and the views.

Amazing place, great nature, you can spot lizards (i saw even a big one) and easy hiking with beautiful beach in the end with small bar with shakes coffee soft drinks. There are toilets in many places. Totally recommended. 100thb entrance, 20thb parking for motorbike.

places.address: ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 7, Phet Kasem Rd, Khuekkhak, Takua Pa District, Phang Nga 82210, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Pak Weep Beach, located in Khao Lak, is a family-friendly destination known for its tranquil atmosphere and entertainment options. Unlike other beaches in the area, Pak Weep offers a quieter and less touristy experience. The beach is lined with trees and features facilities dedicated to children such as slides, tree swings, and inflatable toys. It's also conveniently located near Nang Thong Beach and La On Village for those seeking nightlife.

sources.snippet:
Considered the best beach in Khao Lak for families, especially children, Pak Weep beach is a
good compromise between tranquility and entertainment. This beach is quieter and less touristy than Bang Niang or Nangthong, and you will find facilities
dedicated to children such as slides, tree swings, inflatable toys, beach balls etc. Lined with trees, this beach will allow you to relax by the water or enjoy your delicious meal
while your children have fun.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beach | Which One to Visit?

sources.snippet: Just north of Khao Lak south beach is Pak Weep, where you can really unwind with a massage on the sand. There are no loungers here other than those used by the massage vendors, but there are around a dozen shacks and restaurants where you can grab a cold beer or spicy Thai curry, and yet more picturesque visions of golden sand and crystal waters.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Ban Thap Thawan is at the top of the coastline and is blessed with amazingly white sand and clear shallow waters. Le Meridien is a large resort designed to offer everything guests need to spend their entire holiday in the hotel. There are some restaurants and bars on the beach to get a bit of tropical feel and cheaper prices too.
sources.shortName: The Beaches of Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Also known as Pakweeb Beach, this is one of the least-developed beaches in Khoa Lak. This beach has national park status, so you won‚Äôt find any motorboats. The locals take great pride in this beach and take a lot of care to keep it clean, so this is a great destination if you‚Äôre looking for a low-key, no-frills spot.
sources.shortName: Amazing Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Pakweep Beach‚Äôs national park status makes it off-limits to motorboats. Though one of the least developed beaches, Pakweep Beach allows you to enjoy the sea, sand, and wind without distractions. The locals take pride in keeping this low-key beach in pristine condition, and you will be ashamed not to follow suit.
sources.shortName: Our Guide to 7 Must-Visit Beaches in Khao Lak, Thailand

sources.snippet: Pak Weeb is also the home of the famous Ao Thong or White Sand Beach. Once Khao Lak‚Äôs best kept secret, this small stretch has just three restaurants each with bungalow accommodation. This is one of the most popular day trips for anyone staying in the Khao Lak area.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beaches - Tourist Info

sources.snippet: Slow, relaxed waves lap onto the white sand shores from clear blue ocean waters. You will be surrounded by thick vegetation and many exotic birds!. This is the place to be for families, as your children will be able to swim in the calm sea and splash about.
sources.siteName: Wanderlust Storytellers - An Inspirational Family Travel Blog
sources.shortName: Your Guide to The Best Khao Lak Beaches in Thailand

sources.snippet: Pak Weep Beach is one of the least developed sections in Khao Lak. It‚Äôs known for its vast, open shoreline that‚Äôs perfect for quiet sunbathing. The waters here are clear and calm, making it a great day trip for families with young children.
sources.shortName: What to Do in Khao Lak Explore These 6 Stunning Beaches

sources.snippet: It is located at the end of a road, coming from the south, and there are some restaurants and bars to enjoy the sunset from. Pak Weep Beach is also popular to people who love a stroll on the beach with the jungle reaching into the sand.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Khao Lak | TKL-ToursKhaoLak.com

sources.snippet: For those who wish for a hideaway and escape from the hustle and bustle, Bang Sak Beach and Pak Weep Beach are your option. It is tranquil, suitable for book reading and swimming or strolling along the beach and enjoying the sunset.
sources.shortName: 7 best things to do in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: South of Bank Sak Beach but in the same curving bay is Pak Wib Beach. It is a similar beautiful length of sand curving out to the tip of Cape Pakarang. Again the beach is greatly undeveloped and unspoiled.
sources.shortName: Phang Nga and Khao Lak

places.name: Pak Weep Beach

reviews.text:
Our favourite beach of our month long visit to Thailand. Most other beaches that we went to were really busy which is not our cup of tea at all.

This beach was always very quiet and is ideal for walking for miles in either direction, which we did every time that we visited. We were staying in Khao Lak but it worth the 10 - 15 minute journey heading north to get away from the crowds.
The sea was always calm and ideal for swimming.

We always used The Golden Teak restaurant and bar which is one of the first that you come to as the food and drink were excellent and the staff were brilliant. ( See my review )
We would spend all day there which was so relaxing.

Had a lovely time with my boyfriend, we walked along the beach and played on the swing.
It's such a peaceful, secluded spot with hardly anyone around.
So quiet and calming, perfect for a relaxing getaway.

Beautiful part of this coastline very private beach unknown by most visitors. The water is very nice to swim also the beach is great for walking north to south. It's a very relaxing day here sleeping in the sun. Many small bars and restaurants for food or drinks. You can also bring your own. Lots of tables and chairs and sunlounges all free

places.address: Unnamed Rd, Khuekkhak, Takua Pa District, Phang Nga 82190, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Bang Sak Beach, located at the northern end of Phang Nga's coastline, offers a serene expanse of golden sands and clear emerald waters. The area is home to luxurious beachfront resorts and is surrounded by natural attractions such as waterfalls, streams, and lush forests, providing opportunities for activities like bamboo rafting and hiking. The beach also features charming seafood shacks serving local delicacies and refreshing beverages.

sources.snippet: It is a lovely long stretch of beach that runs around another one of Khao Lak's gently curving bays all the way to Le Meridian at the south.The beach has not been heavily developed. As you come south from Takua Pa along route 4 there are several roads that will take you to the beach. There are just a handful of holiday resorts dotted along the beach but it really is very unspoilt.
sources.shortName: Phang Nga and Khao Lak

places.name: Bang Sak Beach

reviews.text: Lovely beach. Lots of shells, corals and rocks so wear boat shoes when wading into the water. There are jelly fish and sea lice so take care

A really peaceful beach without crowded tourists. There are about 3 restaurants next to the ocean and you can eat on the beach. The road along this beach is quiet and not busy. There are many trees and shadows for picnic and putting up a hammock.
Nice sandy beach. Lots of shade from trees. Small local market with food near the beach.

places.address: Bang Muang, Takua Pa District, Phang Nga 82190, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Small Sandy Beach, located within Khao Lak-Lam Ru National Park, is a hidden gem perfect for visitors seeking a tranquil and pristine beach experience away from the crowds. Accessible via a 45-minute hike through lush jungle from the park entrance, this small sandy paradise offers fine golden sands, Instagrammable rock formations, and a peaceful atmosphere for swimming and relaxation. It's an ideal spot to witness breathtaking sunsets and escape the hustle and bustle of more popular beaches in the area.

sources.snippet:
Location: Small Sandy Beach on Google Map
Small sandy beach is the smallest beach in Khao Lak. This mini paradise is worth a visit as it is only accessible after having made a short trek in the
jungle of the Khao Lak Lamru National Park. If you want to combine a short hike with a moment
of relaxation on a heavenly beach, this is the ideal place.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beach | Which One to Visit?

sources.snippet: Do: You‚Äôll have to pay 200 baht at the entrance to the National Park, but this will get you hiking on a short trail through the jungle, then walking on an absolutely gorgeous and brilliantly named Small Sandy Beach, and will also include a visit to one of the largest waterfalls in the area.
sources.shortName: Exploring the Beaches in Khao Lak: A Complete Travel Guide

sources.snippet: This beach almost got to number one on my list as it was just divine. Part of Khao Lak-Lam Ru National Park, you will need to do a little trek in order to find it. The trail is quite steep in places so take care if you are not a great walker.
sources.shortName: 6 Most Beautiful Beaches in Khao Lak

places.name: Small Sandy Beach

reviews.text: Very pretty and clean beach with big rocks, a kiosk for selling drinks and small snacks. No ice-cream when we went which was very disappointing for the children after the somewhat challenging trek to get there (the nature trail). Showers, toilets, very well maintained and clean. Really nice place to spend a couple of hours.
Small hidden beach. Clean area with nice sand. Shower and bathrooms are available. Bit of a long walk down to the beach but it's worth it. Been going here for years and love it.

Nice and tranquil beach,
There is even a small restaurant around.
They charge you 100 tbh per person on entry as this place is part of a large track, but it's worth it.

places.address: J6FM+55J, Khuekkhak, Takua Pa District, Phang Nga 82190, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Khao Lak Beach is a relatively new beach destination in an area that previously had little local population or nearby towns. It's a peaceful resort area ideal for those seeking tranquility, but not suitable for those looking for nightlife and excitement. The beach is lined with palm trees and offers scenic sunset views, making it a popular spot for leisurely walks. Khao Lak is divided into different village sections, each offering its own unique charm.

sources.snippet: The actual Khao Lak beach is a small one, located just south of Khaolak Lamru National Park, but the name "Khao Lak" is generally used to refer to a 30 km long coastal area from Bang Sak to the north and the Thap Lamu pier area to the south. Beaches continue all the way north up to Ban Nam Khem and Ko Kho Khao and south down to Thai Muang and Phuket, so if you like long walks on the beach, the general Phang Nga coastal area ‚Äî with Khao Lak at its centre ‚Äî is a good choice.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak travel guide

sources.snippet: Khao Lak, is home to some of the most beautiful beaches in the world. With miles of white sandy shores, crystal clear waters and a variety of water activities, Khao Lak beaches offer the perfect setting for a relaxing and rejuvenating vacation. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a secluded spot to sunbathe or a lively area with plenty of water sports, you‚Äôll find it all in Khao Lak.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak

sources.snippet: South of Lak Mountain is where the real Khao Lak village is located, and here is where the almost 2,000 meter long beach, Khao Lak South Beach is located, it is also known as Lam Kaen Beach. This is the first beach you encounter in the whole Khao Lak area when arriving from Phuket. Khao Lak South Beach is located a short distance from all the resorts in Khao Lak Village.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Khao Lak | TKL-ToursKhaoLak.com

sources.snippet: Khao Lak Beach is a beautiful white sandy beach that you will come across when you will come across as you approach the coastline of Phang Nga Province. Actually, the entire seaside area, 30 km up north, from Khao Lak Beach to end at Takua Pa is actually what is named Khao Lak. This is one of the Phang Nga Bay Beaches that is perfect for swimming.
sources.shortName: Phang Nga's Beautiful Beaches Explored

sources.snippet: Ban Thap Thawan is at the top of the coastline and is blessed with amazingly white sand and clear shallow waters. Le Meridien is a large resort designed to offer everything guests need to spend their entire holiday in the hotel. There are some restaurants and bars on the beach to get a bit of tropical feel and cheaper prices too.
sources.shortName: The Beaches of Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Khao Lak is one of the area‚Äôs shortest beaches tucked away under the mountains, removed from the traffic of some of Khoa Lak‚Äôs other beaches. There is a handful of hotels as well as two convenience stores and two bars, so this is a perfect place for anyone looking for a quieter getaway in a tropical environment.
sources.shortName: Amazing Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: The beaches in and around Khao Lak are simply stunning and not busy like the beaches in Phuket. For this reason Khao Lak is still a relatively unknown and remains a small gem of paradise that you must visit before the hoards of tourists discover it. Below we list our favorite beaches in Khao Lak.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beaches - Explore the Beaches Around Khao Lak

sources.snippet: The road rises steeply over a hill that includes the HQ of Khao Lak Lamru National Park. Keep going over the other side of this hill and you come to the area that was the original Khao Lak Beach. This was the place where the first holiday resorts were built.
sources.shortName: Phang Nga and Khao Lak

sources.snippet: The area‚Äôs namesake beach maybe one of the area‚Äôs shortest beaches, but you won‚Äôt run out of things to do in this hidden place under the mountains. Secluded from other shores, Khao Lak sports two bars and several hotels that offer numerous activities.
sources.shortName: Our Guide to 7 Must-Visit Beaches in Khao Lak, Thailand

sources.snippet: Most visitors to Khao Lak come from the south, along Highway 4, from the direction of Phuket. The first beach they reach before continuing over the mountain into the main townships of Khao Lak is Khao Lak South Beach.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beaches - Tourist Info

places.name: Khao Lak Beach

reviews.text:
Lovely beach, sandy and great for swimming, surfing.

Seafood Resturants around the beach.

Great for families

This beach is a very clean, calm and nice beach. It's not crowded at all. You can witness some amazing sunsets on the beach. It's a great beach to just take your beach towel and a good book. A mini picnic basket will be useful too.  If you are interested in taking pictures, then the water looks blue in the afternoon so that's the time for some great pics too :)

Beautiful beach with very nice views in the evening. It's a very good place to take pictures and picnic in the morning/late evening when there's no so much sun. I enjoyed running on the beach barefooted and exploring the rocks for little crabs, fish and snails.

places.generalDescription: White Sand Beach, also known as Coconut Beach, is often hailed as one of the most stunning beaches in Khao Lak. Situated in the bay north of Pakarang Cape, it offers a picturesque setting for visitors to enjoy. Whether you choose to stay nearby or just spend a day there, this beach promises a delightful experience with its pristine sands and inviting waters.

sources.snippet: The White Sand Beach in Khao Lak is located in the northern part of the vacation destination and is perhaps, due to its name, one of the most famous beaches in the region. The snow-white powdered sugar beach is located at Pak Weep and is also not far from Coconut Beach. Especially at lunchtime, the White Sand Beach shines really bright and with a cool drink at one of the cozy beach bars, the dreamlike scenery can be enjoyed twice.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches in Khao Lak

sources.snippet: If you want to enjoy a truly relaxing and luxurious beach holiday, Khao Lak‚Äôs White Sand Beach is your best option. Here, you can choose to stay at one of the many high-end hotels and private villas that offer stunning views and premium amenities. True to its name, White Sand Beach boasts of powdery sand that glistens like crystals under the sun.
sources.shortName: What to Do in Khao Lak Explore These 6 Stunning Beaches

sources.snippet: Just 15 minutes from La On Village, White Sand Beach is true to its name. Powdery sand isn‚Äôt the only aspect that completes the all-over beauty of this gorgeous beach. Tropical greenery in all shades lines the beach and mirrors the jade tones hidden in the crystal blue waters.
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beaches - Aleenta Phuket Resort & Spa

sources.snippet: White Sand Beach is an incredibly beautiful golden sand strip that is almost three kilometres long. It is framed by green vegetation which compliments the green hues of the ocean perfectly. Its located about 15 minutes drive from La On village and the main drag of Khao Lak.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do in Khao Lak 2021

sources.snippet: White Sand Beach consists of 2,600 meters of brilliant soft, light yellow sand and turquoise sea. Unlike other beaches, however, it isn‚Äôt as busy as other beaches in Khao Lak. Know that this beach is a roughly fifteen-minute drive from Khao Lak‚Äôs central urban hub.
sources.shortName: 5 Must See Beaches When Visiting Khao Lak

sources.snippet: Do: There‚Äôs a reef just offshore which makes the beach more suitable for sunbathing as opposed to swimming, be sure to bring your sunglasses and sunscreen as the fine, powder-like sand here is a stunning shade of white and can light up as it reflects the sun.
sources.shortName: Exploring the Beaches in Khao Lak: A Complete Travel Guide

sources.snippet: The clue is in the name, the sand on the beach is not only a stunning white colour but it feels like powder beneath your feet. There are several hotels here which lead right out on to the beach and therefore there are also restaurants.
sources.shortName: 6 Most Beautiful Beaches in Khao Lak

places.name: White Sand Beach

reviews.text: Quiet and pristine beach. 1 hour from the Out Rigger hotel. There is a lovely bar on the beach called the secret bar that you must visit while here. Plenty of other nearby resteraunts and bars too.

It is a lovely beach, not the best I've experienced , not picturesque or paradise, but a good swim and some swings on the beach.  The restaurants want you to eat in their establishment then charge you for sunbeds,, i personally think this is greedy. I sat under a tree as did a few others I ordered a chicken fried rice which was mostly vegetables and 3 bits of chicken I was told because its only 100 baht. Though they did offer to swap for chips as my little one wouldn't eat the chicken fried rice. There is a block of free toilets and shower to use which is especially important for anyone of the females that is on a menstrual cycle or anyone that has a wee problem.
Lovely beach front long walk and easy swimming üòÑ

places.address: P6QR+3MW, Khuekkhak, Amphoe Takua Pa, Chang Wat Phang-nga, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Poseidon Beach is a unique coastal spot with its stunning lava rocks, setting it apart from other beaches like 'White Sand Beach.' It offers a peaceful and quiet atmosphere, making it perfect for sunsets and swimming. The soft sand and clear waters make it an ideal place to relax. Visitors can also enjoy the convenience of several small restaurants and free sun loungers. This beach provides privacy and opportunities for activities such as swimming and getting a massage.

sources.snippet:
Location: Poseidon Beach on Google Map 
This beach is located south of Khao Lak on the other side of the mountain, about 10-15 minutes
from the center of Khao Lak by taxi. It is a very charming little beach, less than a kilometer long, which contrasts with the majority of
beaches in the region which are quite expansive. It‚Äôs a little corner of paradise filled with fine sand lined with trees, complemented by round
granite rocks dotting the landscape, a delightful escape!
sources.shortName: Khao Lak Beach | Which One to Visit?

places.name: Poseidon beach

reviews.text:
Very quiet and beautiful beach, not very big, but we didn't mind.
We found some nice shady spots with sunbeds for free if you eat there.
Great little spot for a day out. Water not to deep. Plenty of day beds. A great cafe/Bar for cold drinks and ice .creams Friendly staff and easy to get too.

The beach is located in the southern part of Khao Lak.
This is the first good and suitable beach for swimming in Khao Lak, if you come from Phuket.
The beach is very different from other beaches in Khao Lak. It is small and picturesque. Huge stones are scattered everywhere.

places.address: J62Q+9MM, Unnamed Road, Lam Kaen, Thai Mueang District, Phang Nga 82210, Thailand
